metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9455 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Android kernel in the video driver there is a kernel pointer leak due to a WARN_ON statement. This could lead to local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1042-aws - 4.4.0-1042.45
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-146-generic - 4.4.0-146.172~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1042.45').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-146.172~14.04.1').
linux-signed package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-146.172~14.04.1').
